channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown trees requiring urgent pruning, 19th July
item.description:
There are a number of attractive trees in the area of the St James Square cul-de-sac which unfortunately require urgent attention and we are hoping that the agency can arrange for some appropriate action to be taken. The trees in question are located in the grounds St James House (GL50 3PR) and consist of attractive silver birch trees located on the north side of the grounds of St James House. Unfortunately, they haven’t been tended regularly and are now “top heavy” and in desperate need of pruning and thinning out, in particular the tops of the trees. Due to their current state, they are severely restricting the sunlight to some of the lower floor apartments of the neighbouring apartment building where we live (GL50 3PY), often preventing sunlight to filter through. To reiterate, we are only asking for these trees to be thinned out, cut back or pruned. I understand that our residents do have the right to light and, although all of these trees are very attractive and no doubt enhance a very pleasant and agreeable neighbourhood, we do see these trees in their current state as a serious problem. We would therefore be grateful if the relevant department would consider applying the appropriate action.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saint James Square, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Keep left signed flattened by 4x4, 19th July
item.description:
Refuge in centre of carriageway collided into at 2.45 by LandRover 4 x 4 driven by elderly gentlemen who drove off without stopping despite the damage to the front of his vehicle.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Queen's Circus, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: Very poor state of road, 19th July
item.description:
This was reported by a resident of Abbotswood Road, Brockworth. I have copied and pasted what they said below: Please find attached copies of video showing the dreadful state of the road outside my property. Not only is it a massive eyesore but also dangerous, we have complained in the past but no action has been taken. Would please consider this as an urgent matter, and respond ASAP Thanking you in anticipation Regards

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbotswood Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 19th July
item.description:
11/07/24 email rcvd, photos attached - To whom it may concern, I am writing to let you know that unfortunately we are no longer in a position to annually pollard the willow tree that is located in the LA verge and to which the previous owner of the property did for many years. You will see from the attached photographs that the tree branches interfere with the telegraph pole and cables as well as causing a H&S hazard to any BT operative working at height on the cable installation. My neighbour has also voiced concern that Severn ’Trent were not happy with it being close to the water services as well as it obscuring line of sight along Gretton Road which at times can be very busy with vehicles exceeding the speed limi. In view of this will you please give your consideration to cutting it down Sincerely
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two ash trees suffering from dieback, 19th July
item.description:
On the corner of Battledown Approach and Battledown Close. I’m told both trees are dying and could be a danger to the public so need to be removed urgently. The stumps also need to be removed as the trees have damaged our iron railings, and I need the repairs to the railings to be paid for by yourselves

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Battledown Close, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
